metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5667 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The sdhci_sdma_transfer_multi_blocks function in hw/sd/sdhci.c in QEMU (akaQuick Emulator) allows local guest OS privileged users to cause a denial ofservice (out-of-bounds heap access and crash) or execute arbitrary code onthe QEMU host via vectors involving the data transfer length.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5667` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.33').
